column4: sometimes I install a package that is just a .deb package and not in the repos that is a newer version then whats in the repos, and afterwards dont need it, is there a way to downgrade back to the repo version without it removing all sorts of other packages?
hrm... removing a package without removing the dependancies?
well, how about just downgrading the package back to the one in the repo
yeah there is no way to remove it without removing the dependancies.  But if you do remove it the config files will remain
